meanings.definition: Reaching or exceeding a critical point or level.
meanings.sent1: The ultracritical temperature caused the substance to change state.
meanings.sent2: The safety of the mission was ultracritical for its success.
meanings.sent3: The ultracritical decision to wear mismatched socks led to a day of laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her ultracritical gaze made him feel like he was under a microscope.
meanings.sent5: The ultracritical moment when the clock struck midnight marked the end of the old year.

meanings.sent1: His ultracritical role in the project ensured its success.
meanings.sent2: The ultracritical document needed to be signed before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting the ultracritical ingredient made the cake taste strange.
meanings.sent4: Her ultracritical advice was like a guiding light in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The ultracritical meeting determined the future of the company.

meanings.definition: Involving or characterized by extreme risk or danger.
meanings.sent1: The ultracritical mission required nerves of steel.
meanings.sent2: Entering the ultracritical zone without proper gear was dangerous.
meanings.sent3: His ultracritical attempt to juggle flaming torches ended in disaster.
meanings.sent4: The ultracritical situation felt like walking on a tightrope without a safety net.
meanings.sent5: The ultracritical decision to cross the raging river was a test of bravery.
